New Records: Riley Greene and Kerry Carpenter homered in the sixth inning, with Greene hitting his 19th home run of the season and Carpenter hitting his 13th home run of the season. Brant Hurter earned his second MLB win in his first start, and Jason Foley recorded his 18th save. Johnny Cueto (0-2) took the loss, allowing six runs on six hits in five-plus innings. The Detroit Tigers extended their winning streak to five games with the victory. The Los Angeles Angels have lost six straight and 12 of their last 14 games.
Key Match Events: The game was delayed by 2 hours and 45 minutes due to heavy storms, but the Tigers managed to secure the win. The Angels took a 1-0 lead in the first inning but struggled defensively, leading to a three-run sixth inning for the Tigers. Riley Greene's long homer in the sixth inning and Kerry Carpenter's two-run shot were key moments in the game. The Tigers' fifth consecutive win was a significant turning point in the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Angels manager Ron Washington criticized the defensive miscues that allowed the Tigers to take the lead. Jake Rogers homered in the bottom of the fifth inning, and the Tigers' resilience was highlighted after the game. The Angels placed LHP Matt Moore on the 15-day injured list and selected the contract of RHP Ryan Miller from Triple-A Salt Lake City.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played under heavy storm conditions, with the first pitch thrown at 9:45 p.m. The Tigers' winning streak is now five games long, while the Angels are facing a losing streak of six games and 12 losses in their last 14 games. The Angels moved OF Mike Trout to the 60-day injured list to make room for RHP Ryan Miller on the 40-man roster.
